title: Condition for relation to be antisymmetric
course: Discrete Mathematics by Prof Sudarshan Iyengar

transcript.text: We have been looking at the same question of given  a matrix M, how do you say if it’s reflexive or
not, how do you say if it is symmetric or not.  Now we’ll ask this question, how do you say that
it is antisymmetric or not. What is given to you,  the matrix M, you are supposed to tell me whether
the matrix corresponds to an antisymmetric  relation or not. How do you say that?
So let me now tell you this, you figure it  out, it’s quite obvious and straightforward.
So did you figure out? All  right, I’ll tell you the answer,
you just verify whether I am right or wrong.  You can check if the matrix M is antisymmetric
or not just by checking if M intersection  M transpose is less than or equal to I.
